noun.description: An adherent of the theory of probabiliorism.

origin: Early 18th century; earliest use found in Ephraim Chambers (?1680–1740), encyclopaedist. From French probabilioriste from classical Latin probābilior more probable, comparative of probābilis + French -iste. Compare post-classical Latin probabiliorista, Italian probabiliorista, German Probabiliorist. Compare also post-classical Latin probabilioristicus.
